message.content:
<<<api>>>: PrintWriter.write
<<<code>>>: 
```java
import java.util.Scanner;
import java.io.*;

class bTree{
    //Fields
    static Scanner input = new Scanner(System.in);
    static boolean done = false;

    public static void main(String args[])throws Exception
    {
        PrintWriter pWriter = new PrintWriter("data.txt");
        do
        {
            System.out.print("Enter command: ");
            String enter[] = input.nextLine().split(" ", 3);
            if(enter[0].toLowerCase().equals("insert"))
            {
                pWriter.write(enter[1] + " " + enter[2] + "\n");
                pWriter.flush();
            }
            else if(enter[0].toLowerCase().equals("select"))
            {
                FileReader fReader = new FileReader("data.txt");
                Scanner fileInput = new Scanner(fReader);
                while(fileInput.hasNext() && done == false)
                {
                    if(fileInput.nextLine().equals(enter[1]))
                    {
                        System.out.println(fileInput.nextLine());
                        done = true;
                    }
                    else
                    {
                        fileInput.nextLine();
                    }
                }
                done = false;
            }
            else if(enter[0].toLowerCase().equals("update"))
            {
                pWriter.write(enter[2]);
                pWriter.flush();
            }
            else if(enter[0].toLowerCase().equals("exit"))
            {
                System.exit(0);
            }
        }
        while(true);
    }
}
```
<<<explanation>>>: The PrintWriter.write() method is used to write to the file. In the case of the "insert" command, it writes the second and third elements of the 'enter' array to the file, separated by a space. This is done by concatenating the elements with a space string (" ") in between. The "\n" at the end of the write method call ensures that each insert command will be written on a new line in the file.
